Fields.DialogueText: Good day, Captain. Lovely weather, isn't it?
That's a funny way to put it.
Whatever do you mean? We have heavenly skies, a salty breeze from the south...
And an approaching formation of Morganas trying to sink us!
That dirty little pack of puppies, all the way out there? They'll hardly cause us any trouble at all.
Would you at least put that umbrella away?
For starters, Captain, this is a parasol. Quite different from a common umbrella.

Fields.MenuText: It's not exactly appropriate for the occasion, is it?
Can't you take this battle seriously?
What if it gets ripped apart by a Morgana attack?

Fields.DialogueText: Why, it is most perfect for the occasion, I do say. A parasol's duty is to gracefully repel troublesome heat and other ills, and that is just what we are doing right now.
I always take my duties seriously. But above all, one must comport herself with a graceful flourish.
Oh, Captain, the parasol is but an extension of myself. As long as I remain pristine, so shall it. And I will not allow myself to be dirtied by such riffraff.
Well, I must prepare for the battle, Captain. So nice of you to chat for a bit.
I admire your confidence, but never underestimate our enemy. The closer the Morganas approach, the meaner they are.
@BATTLE
Bless their little hearts...
Mississippi, what are you doing? And why are those crates behind you buzzing?
Oh, Captain! Those crates are beehives. I thought we'd start a little apiary on the ship. Nothing like some honey to sweeten romance, after all.
It's not the honey I'm worried about so much as --ouch!-- the bees.
Oh! Please do be careful with them! The poor things die if they lose their stingers.
I'm going to find it --ow!-- difficult to stay sympathetic if they keep stinging me.
Oh, but they're sweet things. See how they're pollinating the flowers I'm growing?
I'd ask how you got a garden working at sea, but I'm still hung up on the bees.
Please, Captain, can I keep them? It reminds me of home.

Fields.MenuText: Do you actually know how to handle the bees?
No, they're disrupting the crew.
Thinking about you in a garden, surrounded by flowers... Sounds beautiful to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... not exactly. But there's a first time for everything!
They claim they're ready to fight the Morganas, yet they complain about a few bees? How uncouth!
Why, Captain! Did Cupid's arrows sting you as well? Alas, I'm busy as a bee right now, so you'll have to wait until later to kiss me.
I suppose that you may have a point about the bees, Captain. This rugged life on the waves may be a little too much for them.
Yeah, worry about the bees. Not like anyone else has problems!
Oh, hush. A few stings never hurt anyone too badly. We should be far more concerned about those Morganas over yonder. They'll try to needle us with something a sight worse.
@BATTLE
Really? That seems...
Oh, dear. You're not very good at this, are you?
To Dixie's Land I'm bound to travel! Look away! Look...
There you are. I've been looking for you.
Ah, it's always sweet to have an audience when I sing. How'd I do?
Lovely, Missy. Is everything running smoothly?
I should hope so. With no piano or other instruments to support me, I was worried my performance would seem somewhat lacking. But my voice was up to the task!
I meant the ship, Mississippi. You are keeping track of things, right?
Of course. But that can wait. How did you think I sounded, Captain? Honest opinion, please.

Fields.MenuText: I said it was fine.
You're doing great!
Can't we focus on important things, like... the war?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I see. Playing hard to get, hmm? I suppose I should just try harder then.
Thank you, thank you. Maybe I can put on a recital!
Oh, my dear Captain... one must find a balance between pleasure and business. But do not fret! Stick with me long enough, and I'm sure you'll learn a thing or two.
Well, enough of that. Come along, Captain. We must attend to our arriving guests.
Guests? What guests?
Oh, just a couple of Morgana thugs. We'll take care of them soon enough, and then I can get back to practice.
@BATTLE
That will have to wait.
Brr! Captain, would you mind if I took refuge near the boilers? This sudden wind is freezing me!
It's not so bad. Look on the bright side - maybe it'll snow.
As if that is any better, it's cold enough here to turn the grand old river solid, like a dried-out gator.
Orders are orders. We go where we must, regardless of the weather.
More's the pity. Is there anything we can do? This climate is not at all helping my complexion.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe this weather will slow down the Morganas as well.
It looks like the weather has got your goat.
Here's a blanket to keep you warm.

Fields.DialogueText: A nice thought, but I doubt it. That muck is as stubborn as kudzu. Weather alone won't stop either.
It certainly has! With this chill, I worry we won't be able to generate enough heat to cook the food for the crew.
Thanks, Captain, but you should save that for yourself. I may be a delicate southern blossom, but flowers resurge with life as the sun rises. I'll hang in there.
I can make out some Morganas in the distance.
Good. Are you ready for battle?
Why, of course. There is nothing like a rustic barbecue to heat up the spirit.
@BATTLE
Captain, might I have a word with you? I need your advice with something.
Of course. Anything. What is it?
How would a showboat work on the high seas?
What? A showboat?
I'm glad to know your ears are working, Captain. Yes, a showboat. The ocean is a little rougher out than a lazy river, so I figure we might need a few little fixes.
I just had to say ''anything.''

Fields.MenuText: I honestly don't know.
I'm not sure a showboat's capable of handling ocean waves, Mississippi.
Maybe replace the paddle wheel with something else?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh. Can't say I blame you. Well, thank you anyway. I'll find a way around this.
Oh, no need to worry about that. If riverboats have the nerve to get past blockades of snags and mud, out here will seem like a vacation.
No! That is the heart of the ship, standing at the bow like a grand stairway, welcoming passengers aboard.
Out of curiosity, why do you want to know?
Why, no reason at all!
Coy as ever, aren't you? But we'll have to talk later. I see that we're approaching the enemy.
Do not fear. They're just a sprinkle of flotsam that we'll sweep from our path.
@BATTLE
Trouble is, I don't know exactly what. Any ideas?
Captain, the Morganas have dug themselves in around those islands. We'll need our troops to drive them out if we wish to weaken their defenses.
Agreed. Send them in. And make sure that you provide strong artillery cover.
Will do. My guns will keep the witches busy until everyone is in position.
Just be careful not to get any of ours in the crossfire.
Perish the thought! These soldiers are the backbone of our struggle, a perfect harmony between service on the land and the sea.

Fields.MenuText: What do you think will happen to them when the war is over?
Keep your fire steady.
You really care about them, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know what will happen to them, or me. We'll just have to stick together and support each other.
I'm on it. Those Morganas aren't escaping this time!
Of course. Every one of them is precious to me, and it is my duty to look after them. Just as I know that they'll look after me.
Shall we proceed?
After you, dear Captain.
@BATTLE
So, Mississippi, I wanted to ask, what's with the singing? I suspect it's more than just a hobby for you.
Oh, that? I just thought that we could organize a little show... for everyone in the fleet.
For the entire fleet, huh? What sort of performance?
Oh, dancing, singing, vaudeville acts, the like. I think it would be a most pleasant boost for the morale, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: Just as long as it does not interfere with our official duties.
Have you signed any potential acts yet?
With you as the star, I presume?

Fields.DialogueText: Perish the thought! Just a nice, evening party affair, and then we can get back to eradicating the Morganas. And with you leading the festivities, I know things will run smoothly.
Oh, I almost forgot! Thank you for reminding me; I must see who else is interested. Maybe Idaho or New Mex would like to be a part of it. And you, of course.
Do you think so? Oh, you flatter me too much, Captain! But... I will do my humble best to shine, along with you.
Hold on a moment, Mississippi. What's this about me being in the show?
Oh, dear. Do I hear a bit of stage fright in your voice? It'll be okay, I promise.
That's not what I meant.
We can discuss what act you have in store later. For now, I spy, with my little eye... a Morgana!
@BATTLE
That's good to know... wait, what?
Me?
Now then, do you know anyone who can juggle?
Me?
Two stars shining in the night sky... quite the dreamy atmosphere for a song, don't you think?
Come now, nothing yet?
Hey, Miss. What are you doing?
Oh, trying to catch some fish. I was hoping to fry some up for dinner.
No luck?
Nothing! I just don't understand.  I'm a master at catching catfish on the river, so why can't I capture anything out here?

Fields.MenuText: We can buy some fish when we pull into port.
Maybe you need to use a different strategy when you're fishing at sea.
What kind of bait are you using?

Fields.DialogueText: That's different. You can't deny that there is something wonderful about pulling in and cooking your own fish.
Good point. Maybe someone needs to dive in for a closer look.
My special ingredients. Garlic, limburger cheese, and just a tint of fireweed.
Wait! Oh! I think I caught something.
Hold on, I'll help you reel it in.
Just a little more... we got it!
Great job! It's a big one.
Perfect! Now I can make your dinner.
The fish is for me?
Consider it a little reward for your help. It comes with the secret ingredient of love.
And, oh, not a moment too soon! Some Morganas have swum in to bite, too.
@BATTLE
Wait, ''someone''?
Well, it can't be me! This dress wasn't made for swimming, Captain.
Perhaps the... scent has something to do with it?
Why, are you disparaging my private fish-seducing recipe? Poor manners, Captain!
Well, the fish is ready, Captain. I do hope you enjoy it.
Thank you. It looks great! Time to dig in!
Hold on! We must say grace first. Would you please lead the prayer, Captain?
Me?
Yes. It is a great honor, so I look forward to hearing what you have to say for the blessing.

Fields.MenuText: Lord, give us this day our daily bread, and forgive us our trespasses. Amen.
God... thanks for this food? Amen.
Sorry, I don't really... pray.

Fields.DialogueText: Trespasses... I see. All right, forgive and forget, but I can't do anything about what I've already done.
Not the most elegant prayer I've ever heard... but I suppose it has enough sincerity to suffice.
Quite all right. I'll say the prayer. Dearest Lord, may we all find common ground in our differences, and live in harmony.
Well, then, time to dig in.
Not quite, I detect a Morgana approaching.
They do seem to love ruining a meal. Or anything else, for that matter.
They're likely hungry as well. Unfortunately for them, they will choke on our fire before they can gulp us down!
@BATTLE
I see. Oh well.
Even the Morganas?
If they seek salvation, so be it. If they continue as they have, God will judge them in His time.
"I don't know, but I've been told..."
Oof! Careful!
Are you all right, Captain? I'm sorry, I wasn't watching where I was going.
I'm fine, but... what are you up to? You seem flushed, and you're perspiring a bit. Were you jogging?
Just keeping in shape. A lady needs to maintain a fine physique, after all. Next time we meet, those Morganas won't know what hit them.

Fields.MenuText: Ever think about trying out for the Olympics?
Mind if I join in?
You look kind of cute like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Not a bad idea. But we need to save the world from the Morganas first. Think they'll hold the Olympics in Jackson someday?
Not at all! The more the merrier, I say. Just... try to keep up.
I do? That's so sweet of you, Captain. I might exercise a little more often if it gets your eyes my way.
Time for a bit of stretching first.
Well, you might have to delay them a little while longer, assuming those are Morgana hulls on the horizon.
Ah, at least that warm-up will come in handy. It's time for the real action to start!
@BATTLE
Missy, I'd like a word with you. About this variety show...
Oh? Don't worry, everything is running smoothly. I've found a few people interested in performing, so add that in with yours and mine and we'll be ready to roll.
That's what I wanted to talk to you about. You keep mentioning me as having an act.
You don't have one yet? That's all right. There's still time for you to come up with something.
Mississippi, listen. What I'm trying to say is... why are you expecting me to participate?
Why wouldn't you? I just thought it was only natural that you would want to be a part of it. You're the captain of the ship!
You never asked me...
Okay... then I'll ask now. Captain, would you please take part in my variety show?

Fields.MenuText: No.
I'm still a little annoyed that you assumed I would participate without asking, Mississippi.
I don't know of anything I could do for a variety show.

Fields.DialogueText: What? You won't? But I was so looking forward to it...
I'm sorry my ideas caused you consternation... You're right, and I shouldn't have assumed as much. I just thought it would be fun.
Everyone has their own talents, Captain. I'm positive you do as well.
Maybe I'll consider participating - but only if I can think of something worthwhile to do.
Understood!
But that doesn't mean I can't help with the show's preparations. What do you need done, Mississippi?
Really? You mean it?
Of course. Like you said, I'm the captain of the ship. It's my job to make sure everything on board runs smoothly.
Thank you. We can go over the plans in a bit.
Why the wait?
Because I just sensed Morganas on the way. On with the show!
@BATTLE
Don't count your chickens before they hatch.
Those Morganas have been sitting on the horizon for some time now. How long do you think they'll stay there?
Hard to say. They'll have to move eventually.
I just wish we knew. I'd rather not engage them if possible, but if they come this way - or keep us waiting too long - we won't have a choice in the matter.
We have to stay alert. They might have some trick up their sleeve.
I know, it's just... getting old fast.
Oh, hush. Don't be like that. On a pleasant day like this, it's best to just sit back and wait.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think you could handle them?
Care for a game of cards?
You're pretty good at this.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, but I would have to close range slightly. And I'd don't think that's our best strategy, at this point.
Excellent idea! I suppose a hand or two might pass the time. Time to draw on that ol' Southern luck!
Thank you. I've been trained to participate in stand-offs much more dire than this.
Well, it does look as if they're headed this way, finally. You remember the maneuvers we discussed earlier?
I do. Shall we?
We should. Don't worry, I have this all under control.
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Oh, pooh. Captain!
What is it? Did you spot more of them?
I need to ask your favor. I have a great emergency at hand.
Morgana ambush? An engine fire? Flooding?
No, my dress! It was stained in that last battle, see? I must have it properly cleaned.
That's... that's your emergency?
Of course, and we must resolve it soon. Can you imagine the scandal if I were seen like this?
But what do you want me to do?
Something! Just fix it!

Fields.MenuText: Can't you do it yourself?
Maybe you should consider wearing something a little more durable.
Is it really that bad? I thought you were stronger than this.

Fields.DialogueText: I have other things I must see to. My guns are in need of maintenance which must happen before our next battle.
It would be demeaning to lower myself in such a way.
Well... the battle was quite invigorating. But that doesn't change the propriety of things!
Okay, I'll see what I can do. Take care of the guns in the meantime.
My gallant captain! Thank you!
Pressed and ready, Captain. The silver is polished and my hair is... well... how does it look?
Good enough for combat. Battle stations, Missy!
Or *gasp!* a combat photographer? Oh dear... oh... oh my... I'm feeling faint...
''O, for a thousand tongues to sing, my great Redeemer's praise...''
That sounded lovely.
Ah, Captain! I was just practicing a hymn for the next church service. Did it actually sound good?
You have a wonderful voice, Mississippi.
You make me blush, Captain. I just hope the Lord is pleased as well.
Why that song in particular?
Well, I just liked how it emphasizes so many voices singing as one. If we all put our trust in God and work together, we can turn this war around. Do you think we can do it?

Fields.MenuText: Just remember that everyone has their own beliefs, Mississippi.
If we can let go of our hatreds, perhaps we can.
We'll just have to see for ourselves, won't we?

Fields.DialogueText: You have a point, but God loves all of us, no matter who we are or what we believe. And I believe he'll bring us through this challenge.
That will be difficult, I admit. The heat, cold, and rain all breed discontent and grudges, even down in dear ol' Dixie. But no matter the challenge, I think we're up to the task.
It's all right to be skeptical, Captain. But I think that, the longer we sail the world and help others, the more you'll see God at work in our mission.
Well, the latest challenge to our mission is dead ahead. Are you ready?
In the hour of trials, glory be to Jesus. Let's do this!
@BATTLE
Now, this is interesting...
It seems you finally discovered my little library. What are you reading?
This book here says that there is a special kind of catfish found in the Nile. It actually uses lightning to catch its food! I wonder what it would taste like with that spark?
I assume people would wait until the electricity is dead before digging in.
Anyway, it is quite fascinating. Do you think we could visit Egypt one day?

Fields.MenuText: That depends on how the war fares. Whether we go as a vacation or as a war patrol is anybody's guess.
Well, the climate would certainly suit you.
The Mississippi River is called the American Nile, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. The war comes first. Still, everyone can use a vacation now and then.
It certainly would. That lovely heat would be so comforting right now.
That is correct. Although, I say that my river is much better. For starters, it has more greenery for decoration and the sense to travel down south for the winter.
Say, what sort of shows do you think they would like there?
Couldn't say for sure. Planning a performance for the Egyptians?
Something like that. Oh, will you look over yonder? More Morganas! Bless their little hearts... Time to strike like a catfish.
@BATTLE
Say, Captain? No matter how long I stare at these waves, I can't get a question out of my mind. Mind indulging your Belle?
Of course not. What's the big question, Missy?
Do you think our ship could travel down... or up... a river?
Huh?
Just... curious. Think it could be possible?

Fields.MenuText: You would probably know better than I do.
Why are you asking? Are you planning on implementing it in a strategy?
Sure, if the river was big enough.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, but I was hoping that you might tell me something different. I guess it's impossible...
Not exactly.
Yes, but even a large river is narrower than you think, once you account for traffic, mud, snags, the like. The depth matters.
Well, thanks anyway. It was just an idle dream, I suppose.
What's wrong?
It's nothing. I'll just have to think of something else.
*ALARM*
Ah, you brigands, again. You really picked the wrong time to show up.
@BATTLE
Missy, are you feeling all right? Could just be my imagination, but I'm seeing some lines on that face that aren't usually there.
How brutally honest of you... but at least you're looking closely at my face. I'm fine, but I've got a question, Captain.
What is it?
If a riverboat is not on a river, can it still be called a riverboat?
I'm a little confused. Is this some kind of riddle?
A river showboat? She's a thing of beauty... but could it work out here in the vast sea? Or are such things bound to be forgotten in this ever-changing world?

Fields.MenuText: Is the river necessary for a showboat? The show is all that really matters?
I've always thought of most rivers as just extensions of oceans.
Couldn't you make something that combines the old and the new?

Fields.DialogueText: That's a good point. I do like the spirit of the river traveler, but the show itself could exist elsewhere if necessary. Thanks, I'll have to think about it.
You're right... although, it could be the other way around. Oceans could be extensions of rivers.
That could work! Yes... a graceful and elegant leap into tomorrow, across the stormy seas!
So what's this all about, really? You're making some plans, if I'm not mistaken.
Never rush a lady, Captain! I'm still assembling my vision. Don't you worry, because I'm getting closer to my dream. Thank you ever so much.
You're welcome... I guess? Not sure what I did to help, but I'm glad that you are feeling better.
Nothing can keep ''Mighty Missy'' down! Not even those stubborn Morganas.
@BATTLE
Do-re-mi-fa...
Mississippi, I could hear your singing from belowdecks. Quite nice! Seems your preparations for the show are coming along well.
Aw, Captain. Thank you! I'm really glad that everyone is excited about this, even you.
Anything to keep morale strong in these times is good in my book.
How about your own preparations, Captain? Did you think up something for your own act?
Well, I think I may just have something...

Fields.MenuText: I could play the harmonica.
Are you sure you don't need me to fill in as an usher?
Got a place in the show for some tap dancing? I could do that.

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds wonderful. There is nothing quite like the harmonica ringing out as you sail down a river.
Well, we'll need a little help there, but I don't want you to feel left out. The fun will be on stage, so I was hoping you could be a part of it, too.
Tap dancing! That sounds interesting. Well, as the Captain, you already have one shoe in the door, I suppose.
But actually, Captain, I was wondering...
What?
I know that I sort of dragged you into this - so forward of me - but I was wondering if we could do an act together.
I wouldn't be opposed to it.
Really? In fact... the whole reason I started the show was because I thought we could have fun performing together.
Well, since you asked nicely, it would be difficult for me to turn you down.
Aw, your words are like honey on the tree.
And those darn Morganas are like fire ants at a picnic. Let's hurry to battle stations, Captain!
@BATTLE
Heh, good one.
*ALARM*
Now I see why the Navigator was running to and fro. Why were you gathering up all of these charts?
Oh, I'm just... thinking about something.
It looks like you're plotting a route around the world... but it's not a route I've ever seen before. Does it have to do with the Morganas?
No, this is for more of a... recreational purpose.
What do you mean?
The show is going to be great, don't you think so?
Well, yes, but what does that have to do with this?
I was thinking, what if we did more than one show?
You mean for several nights?
No, I meant around the world. I want to bring a new age of showboating to the world, and bring the spirit of the Mississippi everywhere. Do you think I can do it?

Fields.MenuText: That sounds great!
Will you be able to handle all of it yourself?
What made you so obsessed with showboating?

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. I'll do my best!
It will be a difficult challenge, but I'm sure that I can make it through. Especially if I find friends who can help me build a team.
Because it embodies the emotions of the Mississippi – the river, I mean. The two of us share a sense of elegance and lively energy.
Well, good luck with your dream, Missy. If there's anything to do, just let me know.
Thanks. But for now, let's focus on our opening show – after we deal with that little pack of Morganas, of course.
@BATTLE
"He is coming like the glory of the morning on the wave..."
What is it that comes next? ''He is wisdom to the mighty...''
''... He is succour to the brave!'' Captain! You know this song, too?
It's the Battle Hymn of the Republic. Even many outside of the United States have heard it.
Such an inspiring piece! When evil seeks to sow darkness and despair in the hearts of men, we can trust that God's justice will prevail and bring new hope to all.
I'm just a little surprised you enjoy it. Wasn't that a Union song during the American Civil War?
... It was.
Are you okay?
I'm fine. It's just... there are certain parts of my history - mine and the South's - that I don't like to dwell upon.
I'm a lady of virtue, and the thought that such injustices were allowed to prosper is abhorrent.

Fields.MenuText: What do you think will happen to the Belles when the war is done?
Then you'll just have to do your best to change things now.
Realizing that things aren't perfect... that's our first step to making things better.

Fields.DialogueText: I... don't know. It is our duty as warriors to obey our superiors, but I don't know what lies in wait, once the war is done.
You're right. I'll do my best, for the sake of my home and my God.
Thank you for supporting me in spite of my past.
One thing at a time, though. Let's get rid of these approaching Morganas.
Our truth is marching on!
@BATTLE
So, Miss. Shall we practice our act?
That sounds wonderful. Thank you for agreeing to partner with me.
What are friends for? Though I'm still unsure what we're actually going to... do.
I'm still figuring that out. Maybe I'll let you take the lead on that. How do you think we should go about this?

Fields.MenuText: You sing, and I'll dance.
I'll play the music, and you dance the beat.
Let's sing and dance together.

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds perfect. I know just the melody, it will sound like a warbler on a summer's eve.
But what kind of music? Oh... No matter - when I get going, I can move like a cat.
You mean it? Yes! Let's do that. Together, we'll make wonderful harmony.
Ready to start?
In a moment. Those Morganas never give us a break, do they?
Indeed. Well, we can still perform something for our uninvited guests. A "dance 'til they drop" sort of beat?
Something up-tempo with plenty of gunfire, you mean! Sounds perfect. After you, m'lady.
Why, thank you, my dear!
@BATTLE
Mississippi, Morganas forces spotted heading our way! Get to your station.
Just a moment! I need to finish shining up my guns and armor. Cursed barnacles – the Lord loves all, but I'd wager even he wouldn't necessarily like them.
Can't you hurry up?
This sort of thing takes time. I want everything to be spic and span for our little party.

Fields.MenuText: The ''party'' might start without you if you don't finish up.
I don't think the Morganas will care how shiny the ship is.
All right, then. I believe in you, and so I'll trust you have things under control.

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. What am I waiting for? I might miss out on the fun!
I doubt those bog witches care about anything, but a shiny complexion is important for our own side. Looking sharp can give you the courage to do anything!
Thanks, Captain. I won't let you down.
I'm ready. All guns aimed and loaded!
You know, you're going to be just as dirty as before once the fight is over.
That will be then. This is now.
Well, in any case, time to show them your full might.
@BATTLE
Mississippi?
Captain, remember that conversation I had with you about river boats in the ocean?
Yes. What about it?
And the one before about traveling on the river?
Yes, but I don't see... oh. Does this have to do with your "world tour" dream?
I don't just want to have shows on my boat. I want to BE a showboat! Or, at least, the closest that a warship could hope to be. Any ideas?

Fields.MenuText: Given your style, I'm sure you could deliver the atmosphere of a southern river lady. Just be yourself.
White paint, maybe? I'd worry about keeping it clean, but you already worry about that all the time, don't you?
Install a paddle wheel, perhaps?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, you say the sweetest things! I do have a ladylike delicacy, I will admit.
I always endeavor to maintain my proper appearance... but you have a point. A bit of extra shine might be in order.
So you DO see the importance of that element in the mix! I'm still not sure how to get it to work out here, though.
However you accomplish it, I wouldn't mind seeing a performance once you start touring.
Actually, I was hoping you could be a part of it. A permanent part.
Missy...
*ALARM*
Oh, pooh! Time to punish some more unruly brats.
@BATTLE
And the brashness of a riverboat captain, to boot.
Hey!
Don't worry. I believe in you and in our engineers. We'll figure something out.
Captain... I... thank you.
All hands to battlestations! Enemy inbound!
@BATTLE
Feeling all right, Captain? You look a touch under the weather.
I'm fine, Miss. I just get a little weary sometimes, with these Morganas constantly trying to kill us.
Come on, now! Put a smile back on that face. This war isn't going to end any time soon.
You're right. I – wait! You're hurt!
‘Tis only a scratch. It will heal.
Missy...
What are your orders, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: You're still smiling in spite of all this. You're incredible, Mississippi.
Keep going. We can't let up now.
Be careful, I don't want anything to happen to you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a magnolia, Captain. No matter what tries to tear me down, I keep smiling to the end, like a perfect lady. And then I kick them until they cry!
I'm on it. Those Morganas won't make it past me, as long as I live!
Heh, I may be a sweet Belle, but I'm hardier than I look. It'll take more than this to keep me down.
And I would like to see you get that scratch checked, Miss.
All right, all right, you big worrywart. Once I'm done there, well... there's something I'd like to speak to you about.
I'll be all ears, Mississippi.
That's my girl.
I know that. Doesn't mean I don't worry anyway.
Another lovely day, isn't it, Captain?
Yes, it is. Was there something you wanted to talk to me about? If it is about the show, I was thinking...
No, it's not that. Well, it pertains to that, but it's more than just that.
Miss?
What I'm trying to say is... you know, us southern Belles have a certain flair, if I might say so.
I should say so.
Well, part of that is because we walk a delicate line between duty and freedom.
What do you mean?
We are driven by passion, but a love that refuses to chain itself down. We're known for playing coy and hard to get.
You're a complex woman, Missy. But I guess that's just another thing I like about you.
Do you think... would you like to come with me on the showboat tour after the war? I know there's no guarantee of either of us making it out alive...
But truth be told, I'm having difficulty imagining my life without you in it. What do you say?

Fields.MenuText: You're such a good friend, Mississippi, I couldn't imagine my life without you either.
I'll follow you the world over, Mississippi.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm thrilled to hear that, Captain! This will be wonderful!
I'm thrilled to hear that, Captain! This will be wonderful!
